ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to develop and execute an idea for an art installation and what it really takes to pull it all together. With the three projects in this class I pushed myself to use many different resources here at Yale.

I learned how to think critically about sculptureparticularly about installation art, but also a bit about performance art. I learned how to pitch installations to galleries or collaborators. I learned the importance of allowing a work to become its own work and how to think about why artists make art.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are that it is small and loose structured so everyone can work on their own thing. would be better if it was later in the day.
Strengths was the small class size and the critical readings Aki provided. Aki and Peyton provided amazing support for the class. No real weaknesses.

Class was small, allowing students, professor and TA to bond and talk openly about their work and about the ambiguities of art-making. Class could have been improved by beginning with a focus on planning and foresight methods involved in conceptual art making and sculpture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are considering exploring sculpture and performance art I think this class will really make you think and give you a better picture of what its like.

YES. It will absolutely change the way you approach art-making. Aki is especially inspiringher critiques are honest and always brilliant. She will force you to confront your work for what it really is and not what you wish it was. Her critical eye and thinking process always amazed me. There are so few courses like this at Yale - TAKE BST!
